intro: Racosperma irroratum, commonly known as the silky acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, feathery foliage. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, giving it its scientific name. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils in arid and semi-arid regions. Racosperma irroratum is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native environment.
